results.title: Country school teacher
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the life and work of a typical country school teacher in a one teacher school near Lismore, NSW. The teacher is shown teaching his varied class, leading them in games, and taking a useful place in the rural community. The film points out that isolation is one the main difficulties for a rural teacher, showing a conference attended by many such teachers to discuss their problems. Photography by George Lowe. Music by the East Lismore school choir.

results.title: The Conquest of the Pacific
results.creator_credit: Government of the Commonwealth of Australia
results.brief_description: A record of the arrival of Kingsford-Smith and Ulm at Brisbane on 9th June 1928, after their first successful flight across the Pacific and their official welcome in Sydney including Kingsford Smith’s broadcast greeting to the people.

results.title: Clockwork lemon
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Shows the effects of technological change on the worker in the printing industry. Do computers take away the enjoyment of the job? Have a lot of skills been lost? Is job security at risk?

results.title: Chase that dream
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Tom Manefield, Australia. Dept. of Housing and Construction and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties faced by low income earners in trying to save money to buy their own home or even rent decent premises. Emphasises how important housing is in people’s lives and how a decision taken at one stage affects their ability to get suitable housing later. Cast includes Laurel McGowan, Peter Fisher, Harry Lawrence, Alan Penney, May Howlett, Gary Files. Credits also include camera; Dean Semler and music; John Gillard.

results.title: The Cattle story
results.brief_description: Classroom film on the Northern Australian export beef industry. Historical survey shows introduction of beef cattle to Australia by Governor Phillip. Gives detailed account of beef-raising areas, stock routes and mustering procedures, and indicates importance of the industry in Australia’s economy. Adoption of modern transport methods, in particular, has done much to raise the quality of Australian beef. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Case for books
results.creator_credit: Henry Lewes, Rhonda Small, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Library services in Australia. Shows briefly some of the work of the Commonwealth Parliamentary Library, the National Library with its varied resources, and examples of State, University, special and public services suggesting their value in meeting needs for information at all levels.

results.title: The Car behind
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Advises on the precautions to be taken when driving in front of another vehicle, including procedures for overtaking, increasing the distance between cars, and the use of brake lights, traffic indicators, and hand signals. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Car ahead
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Demonstrates the reaction time between a signal to brake and the application of the brake by the driver. Advises on precautions to be taken when following another vehicle. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Canberra Lake: Springtime sixty-four
results.creator_credit: Neil Howe, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Visatone (Australia)
results.brief_description: Canberra, the national capital of Australia, has a man-made lake in the centre of the city. We see a working model of the lake, dam, flood-gates, various transport routes and bridges. The lake, designed by Walter Burley Griffin, was opened at the end of 1964. Shows the official opening and the use of the lake for water sports.
